Keywords: Utopia , X-Factor , X-Men
Real Name: Scott Summers
Special Powers
TARGETING: Destroy Blocking
LEAD BY EXAMPLE: Leadership, but increases action total by +2 instead of +1.
KEEP IT MOVING, X-MEN: When Cyclops hits, until your next turn friendly characters with the X-Men keyword can use Sidestep.

March 7, 2022
shawn11189
Reduce this down to 75 points and add back the traits from the original piece and this would be a damn near perfect scott. As it stands not even close 125 points is way to much and you loose the good traits from the original. Wouldn’t even consider running this card.
August 31, 2021
Buckwheat
I hate the addition of Mastermind. That's what separates Scott from Chuck; he would never use anyone to accomplish his goals. In today's game, even 100 points is asking a lot for a dial like this. His damage output is meager. It'd be nice if he had some Outwit or P/PB to cut through damage reducers. Only on one click can he deal more than 3 damage. No Force Blast is ridiculous.
June 30, 2021
deathtrooper744
I'm sorry, but this version is much worse. For 25 points less, you lose free retaliation for X-men, ID Card shenanigans, greater attack and defense capability with Energy Shield or Penetrating/Psychic Blast. What do you get in return? A better version of Leadership and a circumstantial Sidestep? For 125 points, as a tentpole, no thanks...
June 29, 2021
fastcat99
Man. In a silver game, I'm definitely sticking to the original card, but this one has some upsides. +2 to your action pool? In a game full of 35-55 point characters, that's huge. You can make a maximum effort turn when you need it.
June 24, 2021
neilr1
Reduced by only 25 points? And all his cool traits are gone? Great.
